data.title: Word Peaks
data.solution:
first_guess = gets.chomp.chars
score = gets.chomp.chars
next_guess = first_guess.zip(score).map do |g, s|
  before = [*"A"...g]
  after = [*g.succ.."Z"]
  s == "C" ? g : s == "B" ? before[before.size/2] : after[after.size/2]
end
puts next_guess.join
data.constraints:
[[next_guess]] doesn't have to be a real word, unlike the real game.
[[first_guess]] is composed of uppercase letters (A-Z).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Word Peaks is an online word game. Like Wordle, you have 6 attempts to guess a 5-letter word.

After each guess, each letter is scored as A (after), B (before) or C (correct), depending on whether it is correct, or if the correct letter is "after" or "before" it in the alphabet.

Given a first_guess and a score, you need to provide an optimal next guess. Each letter in your next_guess should be in the middle of the possible options.

For example if you guessed an "H" and it was scored with a B then there are 7 letters to search (ABCDEFG = letters before "H"), so you should guess the middle letter "D".

If your options were instead ABCDEF (letters before "G"), then "C" or "D" would both be good guesses, but select the later one in this case ("D").

If a letter is scored as C, then don't change it (since it is correct)

Worked example:
first_guess = HEART
score = BBCBA

next guess = DCAIX

ABCDEFG => D
ABCD => C
A => A
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQ => I
UVWXYZ => X

Link to game: https://vegeta897.github.io/word-peaks/
Input
Line 1 : first guess, the 5-letter word that was guessed.
Line 2 : score, the 5-letter score of A, B and C characters indicating after, before or correct for each letter.
Output
1 line : next_guess, the optimal 5-letter guess which will halve the range of possibilities for each letter (favouring later letters when there are an even number of options).
Constraints
next_guess doesn't have to be a real word, unlike the real game.
first_guess is composed of uppercase letters (A-Z).
Example
Input
HEART
BBCBA
Output
DCAIX
